column4: I'm thinking of getting an Acer Aspire One ZG5 with winxp installed and putting linux on it but I can't find any sort of compatibility list.  Does anyone have any information on this?
I am running on an acer aspireone
I have ubuntu 11 going..
What model?
ZG5  or is that ZGS
just got bifocals...   I think it is a zG5  and I only have one gb
How did you install ubuntu 11?
Did you have any problems with the wifi adapter?
That's strange behavior.
the wifi works out of the box on both the ibm build and the other ubuntu builds that I have tried.
Over all what do hate the most about your acer aspire?
screensize and then keyboard is small.   and thirdly I guess I could use some more ram.   but it runs ubuntu 11 just fine
How much ram do you have?
1 gb
actually if I was not tied to a couple of apps i would run ubuntu on my thinkpad
What apps?
mostly   ibm internal apps like the ibm ssct tool
and I have yet to find an mp3/cdg karaoke program for linux...
I see.  I wouldn't know those apps so I wouldn't know a decent replacement either.
I also have a kodak printer  and afaik there is no linux driver for it..
Yeah printer drivers are a pain.  I know for sure cannon isn't very linux friendly at all.  I don't do much karaoke but a quick apt search gave me Performous.  Have you seen that yet?
